Message.Title: Holder Attack Revenge For Adelson's Investigation
Message.Msg: CHICAGO — Las Vegas Sands Corp., controlled by billionaire Republican donor Sheldon Adelson, is the target of a federal investigation into possible violations of U.S. money-laundering laws, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday. The Los Angeles U.S. attorney's office is looking into the casino company's handling of the receipt of millions of dollars from a Mexican businessman, later indicted in the United States for drug trafficking, and a former California businessman, later convicted of taking illegal kickbacks, the Journal said, citing lawyers and others involved in the matter. Topic.Title: Anyone thinking SS funds are not spent in the general fund

Message.Msg: Money comes into SS from taxes each year then gets paid out as benefits, any excess money goes to the General Fund where it is spent. SS clears it's books yearly. SS ran a surplus since it's beginning until recently but those yearly surpluses are long gone. If no one pays in there is no money for benefits. My city retirement fund is ran differently, the employee pays in until retirement and those funds are invested rather than spent, and the fund could pay benefits indefinately even without new employee money coming in.

Topic.Title: Obama Sues to Supress Military Vote

Message.Msg: Your post is another right wing distortion/lie. *************************************************************** The Obama campaign and the Democratic National Committee have filed a lawsuit to block a new state law allowing men and women in uniform to vote up until the Monday right before an election, while the cutoff on early voting for the rest of the public is three days earlier. Top Obama campaign officials told Fox News in interviews that the lawsuit in no way tries to restrict the voting rights of military members. All they are trying to do is even the playing field for all voters in Ohio by allowing early voting up until Monday for everyone, including members of the military, because they believe a two-tiered, early-voting process is unfair. Read more: http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2012/08/04/obama-campaign-sues-ohio-over-early-voting-law-for-military/#ixzz22iqDQmKb

Message.Title: blistering heat waves on global warming
Message.Msg: The research by a man often called the "godfather of global warming" says that the likelihood of such temperatures occurring from the 1950s through the 1980s was rarer than 1 in 300. Now, the odds are closer to 1 in 10, according to the study by NASA scientist James Hansen. He says that statistically what's happening is not random or normal, but pure and simple climate change. "This is not some scientific theory. We are now experiencing scientific fact," Hansen told The Associated Press in an interview. Hansen is a scientist at NASA's Goddard Institute for Space Studies in New York and a professor at Columbia University. He has called for government action to curb greenhouse gases for years. While his study was published online Saturday in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Science, it is unlikely to sway opinion among the remaining climate change skeptics. http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2012/08/05/13129330-blame-blistering-heat-waves-on-global-warming-study-says?lite >>>remaining climate change skeptics<< Of course not! The deniers don't care about the science. The deniers are motivated by politics and religion.
